Great little roti shop right by the beach in Arugambay as you walk past to hit the waves of main point surf beach. The business has been here on and off over 2 decades and still going strong. Open from 5 AM Buzzing with local...fishermen at the crack of dawn drinking tea and eating roti, then along come the surfers for a pre or post surf feed. Tea coffee, juices, banana, coconut, honey roti  and fresh guacamole roti or  curry, dhali and string hoppers from 7 am.  From 5 AM Thick toast, hot drinks guacamole vegetable or the famous pumpkin rotis are served.  Cheap and cheerful place family run from the start, Thath√†  the father is here working daily along with his son thushatha who is the engine of he business, front and back taking orders, cooking and chatting with customers. Still thriving during the covid period due to repeat customers and value for money. You haven't been to A BAY unless you've eaten at THATHTHA'S
Sit inside with the locals or in the huge shaded garden and listen to the birds and the waves. He also has a bunch of new and used bicycles for rent daily or long term,  and modern rooms overlooking the garden and ocean. Give it a crack. You wont regret it.Just started doing AMAZING BANANA PANCAKE AND OMELETTES. To this day I still don't know what this was all about! First time ever that reviews were so deceptive. This dinner - if we can call it like that - was such a surreal experience. As said based on TA recommendation we ended at...this back alley off the main street whith one lady invited us to the yard in front of her house. This should be our first sign that something was off but no I said we shouldn't be so narrow minded and give this place a chance. Then this guy brought us three different menus for different restaurants that was all on TA. That should be our cue to leave the place but still no, we had to be adventurous. He offered a grilled seafood plater for all five of us for 8,5k LKR/person. So 125 $!!! We instead chose 3 prawns, 1 calamari and 1 tuna grilled menu. He then started the home made grilled on the yard near our skuters and preparing the bbq. We were just looking at each other watching the signs of different restaurants which for sure were picked from closed restaurants and brought by this guy to his backyard. Look I'm all for backyard bbq with friends but this is supposed to be a place of business so it was beyond wierd. At the end we finished eating in record time so we could be out of there asap. Kids and our friend eat their prawns, my wife left some tuna on a bloody side and I left all my calamari cause they were completely cold. I hide them under the salad on plate but the guy found them and started asking why I didn't eat everything on my plate. I said I wasn't hungry we went on our bikes while he was talking about expecting a good review from us. Of course he rounded up the bill too for about 500 LKR. We are back at our hotel and still talking about this and waiting for the toilet call to kick in. PLEASE skip this shady pla this back alley off the main street whith one lady invited us to the yard in front of her house. We are back at our hotel and still talking about this and waiting for the toilet call to kick in. PLEASE skip this shady place.

So when we arrived at Arugam Bay we blindly trusted Tripadvisor and went to this Restaurant which was rated as number one restaurant in Arugam Bay. 
We drove into this very dark side road, a few 100 m from the main road. When we entered...this ‚Äûrestaurant‚Äú we were surprised as this was not really a restaurant but someones backyard. The place was really dark and there were no other people in this restaurant, which we thought was very weird for a restaurant which is rated as the best one in Arugam Bay. The whole ambiance was somewhat shady but we decided not to judge a book by its cover and ordered 2 burgers.
The day after, we did some more detailed research on this restaurant as we were still stunned of what we experienced the night before.
We also noticed that there were basically no pictures from guests on tripadvisor which is also a little bit weird for a restaurant that is rated as number 1 on tripadvisor.
And then the next kind of surprising thing we noticed was that the second best rated restaurant (Neptunes Best) in Arugam Bay, is at the exact same location. 

The food was alright and so was the owner but overall we did not like this experience and we did not feel very comfortable during our time at that restaurant/backyard, especially as we were the only guests at this dark pla this ‚Äûrestaurant‚Äú we were surprised as this was not really a restaurant but someones backyard. And then the next kind of surprising thing we noticed was that the second best rated restaurant (Neptunes Best) in Arugam Bay, is at the exact same location. 

The food was alright and so was the owner but overall we did not like this experience and we did not feel very comfortable during our time at that restaurant/backyard, especially as we were the only guests at this dark place.

To this day I still don't know what this was all about! First time ever that reviews were so deceptive. This dinner - if we can call it like that - was such a surreal experience. As said based on TA recommendation we ended at...this back alley off the main street whith one lady invited us to the yard in front of her house. This should be our first sign that something was off but no I said we shouldn't be so narrow minded and give this place a chance. Then this guy brought us three different menus for different restaurants that was all on TA. That should be our cue to leave the place but still no, we had to be adventurous. He offered a grilled seafood plater for all five of us for 8,5k LKR/person. So 125 $!!! We instead chose 3 prawns, 1 calamari and 1 tuna grilled menu. He then started the home made grilled on the yard near our skuters and preparing the bbq. We were just looking at each other watching the signs of different restaurants which for sure were picked from closed restaurants and brought by this guy to his backyard. Look I'm all for backyard bbq with friends but this is supposed to be a place of business so it was beyond wierd. At the end we finished eating in record time so we could be out of there asap. Kids and our friend eat their prawns, my wife left some tuna on a bloody side and I left all my calamari cause they were completely cold. I hide them under the salad on plate but the guy found them and started asking why I didn't eat everything on my plate. I said I wasn't hungry we went on our bikes while he was talking about expecting a good review from us. Of course he rounded up the bill too for about 500 LKR. We are back at our hotel and still talking about this and waiting for the toilet call to kick in. PLEASE skip this shady pla this back alley off the main street whith one lady invited us to the yard in front of her house. This should be our first sign that something was off but no I said we shouldn't be so narrow minded and give this place a chance. I said I wasn't hungry we went on our bikes while he was talking about expecting a good review from us. Of course he rounded up the bill too for about 500 LKR. We are back at our hotel and still talking about this and waiting for the toilet call to kick in. PLEASE skip this shady place.
